00052 /**
00053 *
00054 * @file xosd.c
00055 *
00056 * This is main code of Xilinx MVI Video On-Screen-Display (OSD) device driver.
00057 * Please see xosd.h for more details of the driver.
00058 *
00059 * <pre>
00060 * MODIFICATION HISTORY:
00061 *
00062 * Ver   Who  Date     Changes
00063 * ----- ---- -------- -------------------------------------------------------
00064 * 1.00a xd   08/18/08 First release
00065 * 1.02a xd   12/21/10 Removed endian conversion for text bank loading
00066 * 1.03a cm   09/07/11 Updated XOSD_GetLayerAlpha(), XOSD_SetLayerAlpha(), 
00067 *                     XOSD_SetBackgroundColor() and XOSD_GetBackgroundColor() 
00068 *                     to allow 10 and 12 bit alpha and background colors. 
00069 * </pre>
00070 *
00071 ******************************************************************************/

00089 static void PopulateLayerProperty(XOSD *InstancePtr, XOSD_Config *CfgPtr);
00090 static void StubCallBack(void *CallBackRef);
00091 static void StubErrCallBack(void *CallBackRef, u32 ErrorMask);

00093 /************************** Function Definition ******************************/

00095 /*****************************************************************************/
00096 /**
00097  * This function initializes an OSD device. This function must be called
00098  * prior to using an OSD device. Initialization of an OSD includes
00099  * setting up the instance data, and ensuring the hardware is in a quiescent
00100  * state.
00101  *
00102  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
00103  * @param  CfgPtr points to the configuration structure associated with the
00104  *         OSD device.
00105  * @param  EffectiveAddr is the base address of the device. If address
00106  *         translation is being used, then this parameter must reflect the
00107  *         virtual base address. Otherwise, the physical address should be
00108  *         used.
00109  * @return XST_SUCCESS
00110  *
00111  *****************************************************************************/
00112 int XOSD_CfgInitialize(XOSD *InstancePtr, XOSD_Config *CfgPtr,
00113                                 u32 EffectiveAddr)
00114 {
00115         /* Verify arguments */
00116         XASSERT_NONVOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00117         XASSERT_NONVOID(CfgPtr != NULL);
00118         XASSERT_NONVOID(CfgPtr->LayerNum <= XOSD_MAX_NUM_OF_LAYERS);
00119         XASSERT_NONVOID(EffectiveAddr != (u32)NULL);
00120 
00121         /* Setup the instance */
00122         memset((void *)InstancePtr, 0, sizeof(XOSD));
00123 
00124         memcpy((void *)&(InstancePtr->Config), (const void *)CfgPtr,
00125                         sizeof(XOSD_Config));
00126         InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress = EffectiveAddr;
00127 
00128         /* Reset to use instruction from the OSD internal buffer */
00129         InstancePtr->InstructionInExternalMem = 0;
00130 
00131         /* Set all handlers to stub values, let user configure this data later
00132          */
00133         InstancePtr->VbiStartCallBack = (XOSD_CallBack) StubCallBack;
00134         InstancePtr->VbiEndCallBack = (XOSD_CallBack) StubCallBack;
00135         InstancePtr->FrameDoneCallBack = (XOSD_CallBack) StubCallBack;
00136         InstancePtr->ErrCallBack = (XOSD_ErrorCallBack) StubErrCallBack;
00137 
00138         /* Populate the layer properties into a array to help easy fetch later
00139          */
00140         PopulateLayerProperty(InstancePtr, CfgPtr);
00141 
00142         /* Reset the hardware and set the flag to indicate the driver is ready
00143          */
00144         XOSD_Reset(InstancePtr);
00145         InstancePtr->IsReady = XCOMPONENT_IS_READY;
00146 
00147         return XST_SUCCESS;
00148 }
00149 
00150 /*****************************************************************************/
00151 /**
00152  * This function chooses the type of Vertical and Horizontal Blank Input
00153  * Polarities.
00154  *
00155  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00156  *         worked on.
00157  * @param  VerticalBlankPolarity indicates the type of vertical blank input
00158  *         polarity. Use any non-0 value for Active High and 0 for Active Low.
00159  * @param  HorizontalBlankPolarity indicates the type of horizontal blank input
00160  *         polarity. Use any non-0 value for Active High and 0 for Active Low.
00161  * @return NONE.
00162  *
00163  *****************************************************************************/
00164 void XOSD_SetBlankPolarity(XOSD *InstancePtr, int VerticalBlankPolarity,
00165                            int HorizontalBlankPolarity)
00166 {
00167         u32 RegValue;
00168 
00169         /* Verify arguments */
00170         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00171         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00172 
00173 
00174         /* Read control register and clear the current polarity setup leftover
00175          */
00176         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_CTL);
00177         RegValue &= ~(XOSD_CTL_VBP_MASK | XOSD_CTL_HBP_MASK);
00178 
00179         /* Set up new blank polarities */
00180         if (VerticalBlankPolarity)
00181                 RegValue |= XOSD_CTL_VBP_MASK;
00182 
00183         if (HorizontalBlankPolarity)
00184                 RegValue |= XOSD_CTL_HBP_MASK;
00185 
00186         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_CTL, RegValue);
00187 
00188         return;
00189 }
00190 
00191 /*****************************************************************************/
00192 /**
00193  * This function sets the screen size of the OSD Output.
00194  *
00195  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00196  *         worked on.
00197  * @param  Width defines the width of the OSD output
00198  * @param  Height defines the height of the OSD output
00199  * @return NONE.
00200  *
00201  *****************************************************************************/
00202 void XOSD_SetScreenSize(XOSD *InstancePtr, u32 Width, u32 Height)
00203 {
00204         u32 RegValue;
00205 
00206         /* Verify arguments */
00207         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00208         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00209         XASSERT_VOID(Width > 0);
00210         XASSERT_VOID(Height > 0);
00211         XASSERT_VOID(Width <= XOSD_SS_XSIZE_MASK);
00212         XASSERT_VOID(Height <= (XOSD_SS_YSIZE_MASK >> XOSD_SS_YSIZE_SHIFT));
00213 
00214         /* Save the dimension info in the driver instance for error handling */
00215         InstancePtr->ScreenWidth = Width;
00216         InstancePtr->ScreenHeight = Height;
00217 
00218         /* Update the Screen Size register */
00219         RegValue = Width;
00220         RegValue |= (Height << XOSD_SS_YSIZE_SHIFT) & XOSD_SS_YSIZE_MASK;
00221         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_SS, RegValue);
00222 
00223         return;
00224 }
00225 
00226 /*****************************************************************************/
00227 /**
00228  * This function gets the screen size of the OSD Output.
00229  *
00230  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00231  *         worked on.
00232  * @param  WidthPtr will point to the width of the OSD output after this
00233  *         function returns.
00234  * @param  HeightPtr will point to the height of the OSD output after this
00235  *         function returns.
00236  * @return NONE.
00237  *
00238  *****************************************************************************/
00239 void XOSD_GetScreenSize(XOSD *InstancePtr, u32 *WidthPtr, u32 *HeightPtr)
00240 {
00241         u32 RegValue;
00242 
00243         /* Verify arguments */
00244         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00245         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00246         XASSERT_VOID(WidthPtr != NULL);
00247         XASSERT_VOID(HeightPtr != NULL);
00248 
00249         /* Get the screen size info */
00250         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_SS);
00251         *WidthPtr = RegValue & XOSD_SS_XSIZE_MASK;
00252         *HeightPtr = (RegValue & XOSD_SS_YSIZE_MASK) >> XOSD_SS_YSIZE_SHIFT;
00253 
00254         return;
00255 }
00256 
00257 /*****************************************************************************/
00258 /**
00259  * This function sets the Background color used by the OSD output.
00260  *
00261  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00262  *         worked on.
00263  * @param  Red indicates the red value used in the background color.
00264  * @param  Blue indicates the blue value used in the background color.
00265  * @param  Green indicates the green value used in the background color.
00266  * @return NONE.
00267  *
00268  *****************************************************************************/
00269 void XOSD_SetBackgroundColor(XOSD *InstancePtr, u16 Red, u16 Blue, u16 Green)
00270 {
00271         u32 RegValue;
00272 
00273         /* Verify arguments */
00274         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00275         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00276 
00277         /* Update the Background Color register */
00278         RegValue = Green & XOSD_BC0_YG_MASK;
00279         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_BC0, RegValue);
00280 
00281         RegValue = Blue & XOSD_BC1_UCBB_MASK;
00282         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_BC1, RegValue);
00283 
00284         RegValue = Red & XOSD_BC2_VCRR_MASK;
00285         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_BC2, RegValue);
00286 
00287         return;
00288 }
00289 
00290 /*****************************************************************************/
00291 /**
00292  * This function gets the Background color used by the OSD output.
00293  *
00294  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00295  *         worked on.
00296  * @param  RedPtr will point to the red value used in the background color
00297  *         after this function returns.
00298  * @param  BluePtr will point to the blue value used in the background color
00299  *         after this function returns.
00300  * @param  GreenPtr will point to the green value used in the background color
00301  *         after this function returns.
00302  * @return NONE.
00303  *
00304  *****************************************************************************/
00305 void XOSD_GetBackgroundColor(XOSD *InstancePtr, u16 *RedPtr, u16 *BluePtr,
00306                                                          u16 *GreenPtr)
00307 {
00308         u32 RegValue;
00309 
00310         /* Verify arguments */
00311         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00312         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00313         XASSERT_VOID(RedPtr != NULL);
00314         XASSERT_VOID(BluePtr != NULL);
00315         XASSERT_VOID(GreenPtr != NULL);
00316 
00317         /* Get the background color */
00318         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_BC0);
00319         *GreenPtr = (u16)(RegValue & XOSD_BC0_YG_MASK);
00320 
00321         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_BC1);
00322         *BluePtr = (u16)(RegValue & XOSD_BC1_UCBB_MASK);
00323 
00324         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg((InstancePtr)->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_BC2);
00325         *RedPtr = (u16)(RegValue & XOSD_BC2_VCRR_MASK);
00326 
00327         return;
00328 }
00329 
00330 /*****************************************************************************/
00331 /**
00332  * This function sets the start position and size of an OSD layer.
00333  *
00334  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
00335  * @param  LayerIndex indicates which layer to be worked on. Valid value range
00336  *         is from 0 to (the number of layers implemented in the device - 1).
00337  * @param  XStart indicates the Horizontal start pixel of origin of the layer.
00338  * @param  YStart indicates the Vertical start line of origin of the layer.
00339  * @param  XSize indicates the Horizontal Size of the layer.
00340  * @param  YSize indicates the Vertical Size of the layer.
00341  * @return NONE.
00342  *
00343  *****************************************************************************/
00344 void XOSD_SetLayerDimension(XOSD *InstancePtr, u8 LayerIndex, u16 XStart,
00345                                 u16 YStart, u16 XSize, u16 YSize)
00346 {
00347         u32 LayerBaseRegAddr;
00348         u32 RegValue;
00349 
00350         /* Verify arguments */
00351         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00352         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00353         XASSERT_VOID(LayerIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
00354         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[LayerIndex].LayerType != \
00355                                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_DISABLE);
00356         XASSERT_VOID(XSize > 0);
00357         XASSERT_VOID(YSize > 0);
00358         XASSERT_VOID((XStart + XSize) <= InstancePtr->ScreenWidth);
00359         XASSERT_VOID((YStart + YSize) <= InstancePtr->ScreenHeight);
00360 
00361         /* Calculate the base register address of the layer to work on */
00362         LayerBaseRegAddr = XOSD_L0C + (LayerIndex * XOSD_LAYER_SIZE);
00363 
00364         /* Set the origin of the layer */
00365         RegValue = XStart & XOSD_LXP_XSTART_MASK;
00366         RegValue |= (((u32)YStart) << XOSD_LXP_YSTART_SHIFT) &
00367                         XOSD_LXP_YSTART_MASK;
00368         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00369                         LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXP,
00370                         RegValue);
00371 
00372         /* Set the size of the layer */
00373         RegValue = XSize & XOSD_LXS_XSIZE_MASK;
00374         RegValue |= (((u32)YSize) << XOSD_LXS_YSIZE_SHIFT) &
00375                         XOSD_LXS_YSIZE_MASK;
00376         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00377                         LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXS,
00378                         RegValue);
00379 
00380         return;
00381 }
00382 
00383 /*****************************************************************************/
00384 /**
00385  * This function gets the start position and size of an OSD layer.
00386  *
00387  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00388  *         worked on.
00389  * @param  LayerIndex indicates which layer to be worked on. Valid value range
00390  *         is from 0 to (the number of layers implemented in the device - 1).
00391  * @param  XStartPtr will point to the Horizontal start pixel value of origin
00392  *         of the layer after this function returns.
00393  * @param  YStartPtr will point to the Vertical start line of origin of the
00394  *         layer after this function returns.
00395  * @param  XSizePtr will point to the Horizontal Size value of the layer after
00396  *         this function returns.
00397  * @param  YSizePtr will point to the Vertical Size value of the layer after
00398  *         this function returns.
00399  * @return NONE.
00400  *
00401  *****************************************************************************/
00402 void XOSD_GetLayerDimension(XOSD *InstancePtr, u8 LayerIndex, u16 *XStartPtr,
00403                         u16 *YStartPtr, u16 *XSizePtr, u16 *YSizePtr)
00404 {
00405         u32 LayerBaseRegAddr;
00406         u32 RegValue;
00407 
00408         /* Verify arguments */
00409         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00410         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00411         XASSERT_VOID(LayerIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
00412         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[LayerIndex].LayerType != \
00413                                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_DISABLE);
00414         XASSERT_VOID(XStartPtr != NULL);
00415         XASSERT_VOID(YStartPtr != NULL);
00416         XASSERT_VOID(XSizePtr != NULL);
00417         XASSERT_VOID(YSizePtr != NULL);
00418 
00419         /* Calculate the base register address of the layer to work on */
00420         LayerBaseRegAddr = XOSD_L0C + (LayerIndex * XOSD_LAYER_SIZE);
00421 
00422         /* Get the origin of the layer */
00423         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00424                                 LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXP);
00425         *XStartPtr = (u16) (RegValue & XOSD_LXP_XSTART_MASK);
00426         *YStartPtr = (u16) ((RegValue & XOSD_LXP_YSTART_MASK) >>
00427                                 XOSD_LXP_YSTART_SHIFT);
00428 
00429         /* Get the size of the layer */
00430         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00431                                 LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXS);
00432         *XSizePtr = (u16) (RegValue & XOSD_LXS_XSIZE_MASK);
00433         *YSizePtr = (u16) ((RegValue & XOSD_LXS_YSIZE_MASK) >>
00434                                 XOSD_LXS_YSIZE_SHIFT);
00435 
00436         return;
00437 }
00438 
00439 /*****************************************************************************/
00440 /**
00441  * This function sets the Alpha value and mode of an OSD layer.
00442  *
00443  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00444  *         worked on.
00445  * @param  LayerIndex indicates which layer to be worked on. Valid value range
00446  *         is from 0 to (the number of layers implemented in the device - 1).
00447  * @param  GlobalAlphaEnble indicates whether to enable the global Alpha. Use
00448  *         any non-0 value to enable the global Alpha, and 0 to disable it.
00449  * @param  GlobalAlphaValue indicates the transparent level. 0 for 100%
00450  *         transparent, 255 (8bit) for 0% transparent (100% opaque). This argument
00451  *         will be ignored if parameter GlobalAlphaEnble has value 0.
00452  * @return NONE.
00453  *
00454  *****************************************************************************/
00455 void XOSD_SetLayerAlpha(XOSD *InstancePtr, u8 LayerIndex, u16 GlobalAlphaEnble,
00456                         u16 GlobalAlphaValue)
00457 {
00458         u32 LayerBaseRegAddr;
00459         u32 RegValue;
00460 
00461         /* Verify arguments */
00462         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00463         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00464         XASSERT_VOID(LayerIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
00465         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[LayerIndex].LayerType != \
00466                                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_DISABLE);
00467 
00468         /* Calculate the base register address of the layer to work on */
00469         LayerBaseRegAddr = XOSD_L0C + (LayerIndex * XOSD_LAYER_SIZE);
00470 
00471         /* Read the current Layer Control register value */
00472         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00473                                         LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXC);
00474 
00475         /* Update the Global Alpha Enable and the Global Alpha Value fields */
00476         if (GlobalAlphaEnble)
00477                 RegValue |= XOSD_LXC_GALPHAEN_MASK;
00478         else
00479                 RegValue &= ~XOSD_LXC_GALPHAEN_MASK;
00480 
00481         RegValue &= ~XOSD_LXC_ALPHA_MASK;
00482         RegValue |= (((u32)GlobalAlphaValue) << XOSD_LXC_ALPHA_SHIFT) &
00483                         XOSD_LXC_ALPHA_MASK;
00484         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00485                         LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXC, RegValue);
00486 
00487         return;
00488 }
00489 
00490 /*****************************************************************************/
00491 /**
00492  * This function gets the Alpha value and mode of an OSD layer.
00493  *
00494  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00495  *         worked on.
00496  * @param  LayerIndex indicates which layer to be worked on. Valid value range
00497  *         is from 0 to (the number of layers implemented in the device - 1).
00498  * @param  GlobalAlphaEnblePtr will point to a flag indicating whether the
00499  *         global Alpha is enabled on a layer after this function returns.
00500  *         Flag 1 indicates that the global Alpha is enabled, 0 indicates that
00501  *         it is not.
00502  * @param  GlobalAlphaValuePtr will point to the transparent level after this
00503  *         function returns. 0 for 100% transparent, 255 (8bit) for 0% transparent
00504  *         (100% opaque).
00505  * @return NONE.
00506  *
00507  *****************************************************************************/
00508 void XOSD_GetLayerAlpha(XOSD *InstancePtr, u8 LayerIndex,
00509                         u16 *GlobalAlphaEnblePtr, u16 *GlobalAlphaValuePtr)
00510 {
00511         u32 LayerBaseRegAddr;
00512         u32 RegValue;
00513 
00514         /* Verify arguments */
00515         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00516         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00517         XASSERT_VOID(LayerIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
00518         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[LayerIndex].LayerType != \
00519                                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_DISABLE);
00520         XASSERT_VOID(GlobalAlphaEnblePtr != NULL);
00521         XASSERT_VOID(GlobalAlphaValuePtr != NULL);
00522 
00523         /* Calculate the base register address of the layer to work on */
00524         LayerBaseRegAddr = XOSD_L0C + (LayerIndex * XOSD_LAYER_SIZE);
00525 
00526         /* Read the current Layer Control register value */
00527         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00528                                 LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXC);
00529 
00530         /* Get the info of the Global Alpha Enable and the Global Alpha Value
00531          * fields
00532          */
00533         *GlobalAlphaEnblePtr = (u16)
00534                                 ((RegValue & XOSD_LXC_GALPHAEN_MASK) ? 1 : 0);
00535         *GlobalAlphaValuePtr = (u16) ((RegValue & XOSD_LXC_ALPHA_MASK) >>
00536                                 XOSD_LXC_ALPHA_SHIFT);
00537 
00538         return;
00539 }
00540 
00541 /*****************************************************************************/
00542 /**
00543  * This function sets the priority of an OSD layer.
00544  *
00545  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00546  *         worked on.
00547  * @param  LayerIndex indicates which layer to be worked on. Valid value range
00548  *         is from 0 to (the number of layers implemented in the device - 1).
00549  * @param  Priority indicates the priority to be applied on the layer. Use
00550  *         one of XOSD_LAYER_PRIORITY_0 (the lowest priority) through
00551  *         XOSD_LAYER_PRIORITY_7 (the highest priority) defined in xosd_hw.h
00552  * @return NONE.
00553  *
00554  *****************************************************************************/
00555 void XOSD_SetLayerPriority(XOSD *InstancePtr, u8 LayerIndex, u8 Priority)
00556 {
00557         u32 LayerBaseRegAddr;
00558         u32 RegValue;
00559 
00560         /* Verify arguments */
00561         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00562         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00563         XASSERT_VOID(LayerIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
00564         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[LayerIndex].LayerType != \
00565                                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_DISABLE);
00566         XASSERT_VOID(Priority <= XOSD_LAYER_PRIORITY_7);
00567 
00568         /* Calculate the base register address of the layer to work on */
00569         LayerBaseRegAddr = XOSD_L0C + (LayerIndex * XOSD_LAYER_SIZE);
00570 
00571         /* Read the current Layer Control register value */
00572         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00573                                 LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXC);
00574 
00575         /* Update the Priority field */
00576         RegValue &= ~XOSD_LXC_PRIORITY_MASK;
00577         RegValue |= (((u32)Priority) << XOSD_LXC_PRIORITY_SHIFT)
00578                                         & XOSD_LXC_PRIORITY_MASK;
00579         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00580                         LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXC, RegValue);
00581 
00582         return;
00583 }
00584 
00585 /*****************************************************************************/
00586 /**
00587  * This function gets the priority of an OSD layer.
00588  *
00589  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00590  *         worked on.
00591  * @param  LayerIndex indicates which layer to be worked on. Valid value range
00592  *         is from 0 to (the number of layers implemented in the device - 1).
00593  * @param  PriorityPtr will point to the priority used on the layer after this
00594  *         function returns. Use XOSD_LAYER_PRIORITY_... defined in xosd_hw.h
00595  *         to interpret the value.
00596  * @return NONE.
00597  *
00598  *****************************************************************************/
00599 void XOSD_GetLayerPriority(XOSD *InstancePtr, u8 LayerIndex, u8 *PriorityPtr)
00600 {
00601         u32 LayerBaseRegAddr;
00602         u32 RegValue;
00603 
00604         /* Verify arguments */
00605         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00606         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00607         XASSERT_VOID(LayerIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
00608         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[LayerIndex].LayerType != \
00609                                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_DISABLE);
00610         XASSERT_VOID(PriorityPtr != NULL);
00611 
00612         /* Calculate the base register address of the layer to work on */
00613         LayerBaseRegAddr = XOSD_L0C + (LayerIndex * XOSD_LAYER_SIZE);
00614 
00615         /* Read the current Layer Control register value */
00616         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00617                         LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXC);
00618 
00619         /* Get the Priority field */
00620         *PriorityPtr = (u8)((RegValue & XOSD_LXC_PRIORITY_MASK) >>
00621                                 XOSD_LXC_PRIORITY_SHIFT);
00622 
00623         return;
00624 }
00625 
00626 /*****************************************************************************/
00627 /**
00628  * This function enables an OSD layer.
00629  *
00630  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00631  *         worked on.
00632  * @param  LayerIndex indicates which layer to be worked on. Valid value range
00633  *         is from 0 to (the number of layers implemented in the device - 1).
00634  * @return NONE.
00635  *
00636  *****************************************************************************/
00637 void XOSD_EnableLayer(XOSD *InstancePtr, u8 LayerIndex)
00638 {
00639         u32 LayerBaseRegAddr;
00640         u32 RegValue;
00641 
00642         /* Verify arguments */
00643         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00644         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00645         XASSERT_VOID(LayerIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
00646         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[LayerIndex].LayerType != \
00647                                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_DISABLE);
00648 
00649         /* Calculate the base register address of the layer to work on */
00650         LayerBaseRegAddr = XOSD_L0C + (LayerIndex * XOSD_LAYER_SIZE);
00651 
00652         /* Read the current Layer Control register value */
00653         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00654                                 LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXC);
00655 
00656         /* Set the Layer Enable field */
00657         RegValue |= XOSD_LXC_EN_MASK;
00658         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00659                         LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXC,
00660                         RegValue);
00661 
00662         return;
00663 }
00664 
00665 /*****************************************************************************/
00666 /**
00667  * This function disables an OSD layer.
00668  *
00669  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00670  *         worked on.
00671  * @param  LayerIndex indicates which layer to be worked on. Valid value range
00672  *         is from 0 to (the number of layers implemented in the device - 1).
00673  * @return NONE.
00674  *
00675  *****************************************************************************/
00676 void XOSD_DisableLayer(XOSD *InstancePtr, u8 LayerIndex)
00677 {
00678         u32 LayerBaseRegAddr;
00679         u32 RegValue;
00680 
00681         /* Verify arguments */
00682         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00683         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00684         XASSERT_VOID(LayerIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
00685         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[LayerIndex].LayerType != \
00686                                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_DISABLE);
00687 
00688         /* Calculate the base register address of the layer to work on */
00689         LayerBaseRegAddr = XOSD_L0C + (LayerIndex * XOSD_LAYER_SIZE);
00690 
00691         /* Read the current Layer Control register value */
00692         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00693                                 LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXC);
00694 
00695         /* Clear the Layer Enable field */
00696         RegValue &= ~XOSD_LXC_EN_MASK;
00697         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00698                         LayerBaseRegAddr + XOSD_LXC,
00699                         RegValue);
00700 }
00701 
00702 /*****************************************************************************/
00703 /**
00704  * This function loads color LUT data into an OSD Graphics Controller Bank.
00705  *
00706  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00707  *         worked on.
00708  * @param  GcIndex indicates which Graphics Controller to work on. Valid value
00709  *         range is from 0 to (The Number of Layers) - 1. The layer's type must
00710  *         be set to XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_GPU (defined in xosd_hw.h) for this
00711  *         function to work properly.
00712  * @param  BankIndex indicates which GC Bank to be worked on. Valid value range
00713  *         is from 0 to XOSD_GC_BANK_NUM - 1.
00714  * @param  ColorData points to the color LUT data to be loaded.
00715  * @return NONE.
00716  *
00717  *****************************************************************************/
00718 void XOSD_LoadColorLUTBank(XOSD *InstancePtr, u8 GcIndex, u8 BankIndex,
00719                                 u32 *ColorData)
00720 {
00721         u32 i;
00722         u32 RegValue;
00723 
00724         /* Verify arguments */
00725         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00726         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00727         XASSERT_VOID(GcIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
00728         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].LayerType ==
00729                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_GPU);
00730         XASSERT_VOID(BankIndex < XOSD_GC_BANK_NUM);
00731         XASSERT_VOID(ColorData != NULL);
00732 
00733         /* Choose which bank to be loaded */
00734         RegValue = (((u32)BankIndex) + XOSD_GCWBA_COL0) & XOSD_GCWBA_BANK_MASK;
00735         RegValue |= (((u32)GcIndex) << XOSD_GCWBA_GCNUM_SHIFT)
00736                                         & XOSD_GCWBA_GCNUM_MASK;
00737         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCWBA, RegValue);
00738 
00739         /* Load color data */
00740         for (i = 0;
00741         i < (InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].ColorLutSize * XOSD_COLOR_ENTRY_SIZE)
00742                                 / sizeof(u32);
00743         i++) {
00744                 XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00745                                 XOSD_GCD, ColorData[i]);
00746         }
00747 
00748         /* Set the active color LUT bank */
00749         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCABA);
00750         RegValue &= ~(1 << (XOSD_GCABA_COL_SHIFT + GcIndex));
00751         RegValue |= ((u32)BankIndex) << (XOSD_GCABA_COL_SHIFT + (u32)GcIndex);
00752         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCABA, RegValue);
00753 
00754         return;
00755 }
00756 
00757 /*****************************************************************************/
00758 /**
00759  * This function loads Character Set data (font) into an OSD Graphics
00760  * Controller Bank.
00761  *
00762  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00763  *         worked on.
00764  * @param  GcIndex indicates which Graphics Controller to work on. Valid value
00765  *         range is from 0 to (The Number of Layers) - 1. The layer's type must
00766  *         be set to XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_GPU (defined in xosd_hw.h) for this
00767  *         function to work properly.
00768  * @param  BankIndex indicates which GC Bank to be worked on. Valid value range
00769  *         is from 0 to XOSD_GC_BANK_NUM - 1.
00770  * @param  CharSetData points to the Character Set data to be loaded.
00771  * @return NONE.
00772  *
00773  *****************************************************************************/
00774 void XOSD_LoadCharacterSetBank(XOSD *InstancePtr, u8 GcIndex, u8 BankIndex,
00775                                 u32 *CharSetData)
00776 {
00777         u32 RegValue;
00778         u32 FontWriteNum;
00779         u32 i;
00780 
00781         /* Verify arguments */
00782         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00783         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00784         XASSERT_VOID(GcIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
00785         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].LayerType ==
00786                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_GPU);
00787         XASSERT_VOID(BankIndex < XOSD_GC_BANK_NUM);
00788         XASSERT_VOID(CharSetData != NULL);
00789 
00790         /* Choose which bank to be loaded */
00791         RegValue = (((u32)BankIndex) + XOSD_GCWBA_CHR0) & XOSD_GCWBA_BANK_MASK;
00792         RegValue |= (((u32)GcIndex) << XOSD_GCWBA_GCNUM_SHIFT)
00793                                         & XOSD_GCWBA_GCNUM_MASK;
00794         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCWBA, RegValue);
00795 
00796         /* Calculate the number of write to load the whole font data set */
00797         FontWriteNum = ((u32)InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].FontWidth) *
00798                         ((u32)InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].FontHeight) *
00799                         ((u32)InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].FontBitsPerPixel);
00800         FontWriteNum /= XOSD_FONT_BIT_TO_BYTE;
00801         FontWriteNum *= ((u32)InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].FontNumChars);
00802         FontWriteNum /= sizeof(u32);
00803 
00804         /* Load the font data */
00805         for (i = 0; i < FontWriteNum; i++) {
00806                 XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCD,
00807                                 CharSetData[i]);
00808         }
00809 
00810         /* Set the bank to be active so the font is used by the core */
00811         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCABA);
00812         RegValue &= ~(1 << (XOSD_GCABA_CHR_SHIFT + GcIndex));
00813         RegValue |= ((u32)BankIndex) << (XOSD_GCABA_CHR_SHIFT + (u32)GcIndex);
00814         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCABA, RegValue);
00815 }
00816 
00817 /*****************************************************************************/
00818 /**
00819  * This function loads Text data into an OSD Graphics Controller Bank.
00820  *
00821  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00822  *         worked on.
00823  * @param  GcIndex indicates which Graphics Controller to work on. Valid value
00824  *         range is from 0 to (The Number of Layers) - 1. The layer's type must
00825  *         be set to XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_GPU (defined in xosd_hw.h) for this
00826  *         function to work properly.
00827  * @param  BankIndex indicates which GC Bank to be worked on. Valid value range
00828  *         is from 0 to XOSD_GC_BANK_NUM - 1.
00829  * @param  TextData points to the Text data to be loaded.
00830  * @return NONE.
00831  *
00832  *****************************************************************************/
00833 void XOSD_LoadTextBank(XOSD *InstancePtr, u8 GcIndex, u8 BankIndex,
00834                         u32 *TextData)
00835 {
00836         u32 i;
00837         u32 RegValue;
00838         u32 Data;
00839 
00840         /* Verify arguments */
00841         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00842         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00843         XASSERT_VOID(GcIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
00844         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].LayerType ==
00845                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_GPU);
00846         XASSERT_VOID(BankIndex < XOSD_GC_BANK_NUM);
00847         XASSERT_VOID(TextData != NULL);
00848 
00849         /* Choose which bank to be loaded */
00850         RegValue = (((u32)BankIndex) + XOSD_GCWBA_TXT0) & XOSD_GCWBA_BANK_MASK;
00851         RegValue |= (((u32)GcIndex) << XOSD_GCWBA_GCNUM_SHIFT)
00852                                         & XOSD_GCWBA_GCNUM_MASK;
00853         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCWBA, RegValue);
00854 
00855         /* Load text data */
00856         for (i = 0;
00857         i < (u32)(InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].TextNumStrings) *
00858                 (u32)(InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].TextMaxStringLength) /
00859                 sizeof(u32);
00860         i++) {
00861                 XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
00862                                 XOSD_GCD, TextData[i]);
00863         }
00864 
00865         /* Set the active text bank */
00866         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCABA);
00867         RegValue &= ~(1 << (XOSD_GCABA_TXT_SHIFT + GcIndex));
00868         RegValue |= ((u32)BankIndex) << (XOSD_GCABA_TXT_SHIFT + (u32)GcIndex);
00869         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCABA, RegValue);
00870 
00871         return;
00872 }
00873 
00874 /*****************************************************************************/
00875 /**
00876  * This function chooses active banks for a GC in an OSD device.
00877  *
00878  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00879  *         worked on.
00880  * @param  GcIndex indicates which Graphics Controller to work on. Valid value
00881  *         range is from 0 to (The Number of Layers) - 1. The layer's type must
00882  *         be set to XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_GPU (defined in xosd_hw.h) for this
00883  *         function to work properly.
00884  * @param  ColorBankIndex indicates the Color LUT bank to be choose as active.
00885  * @param  CharBankIndex indicates the Character Set bank to be choose as
00886  *         active.
00887  * @param  TextBankIndex indicates the Text Data bank to be choose as active.
00888  * @param  InstructionBankIndex indicates the Instruction bank to be choose as
00889  *         active.
00890  * @return NONE.
00891  *
00892  *****************************************************************************/
00893 void XOSD_SetActiveBank(XOSD *InstancePtr, u8 GcIndex, u8 ColorBankIndex,
00894                         u8 CharBankIndex, u8 TextBankIndex,
00895                         u8 InstructionBankIndex)
00896 {
00897         u32 RegValue;
00898 
00899         /* Verify arguments */
00900         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00901         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00902         XASSERT_VOID(GcIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
00903         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].LayerType ==
00904                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_GPU);
00905         XASSERT_VOID(ColorBankIndex < XOSD_GC_BANK_NUM);
00906         XASSERT_VOID(CharBankIndex < XOSD_GC_BANK_NUM);
00907         XASSERT_VOID(TextBankIndex < XOSD_GC_BANK_NUM);
00908         XASSERT_VOID(InstructionBankIndex < XOSD_GC_BANK_NUM);
00909 
00910         /* Clear the current active bank setting first */
00911         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCABA);
00912         RegValue &= ~(1 << GcIndex) & XOSD_GCABA_INS_MASK;
00913         RegValue &= ~(1 << (XOSD_GCABA_COL_SHIFT + GcIndex)) &
00914                         XOSD_GCABA_COL_MASK;
00915         RegValue &= ~(1 << (XOSD_GCABA_TXT_SHIFT + GcIndex)) &
00916                         XOSD_GCABA_TXT_MASK;
00917         RegValue &= ~(1 << (XOSD_GCABA_CHR_SHIFT + GcIndex)) &
00918                         XOSD_GCABA_CHR_MASK;
00919 
00920         /* Choose the active banks */
00921         RegValue |= (((u32)InstructionBankIndex) << GcIndex) &
00922                         XOSD_GCABA_INS_MASK;
00923         RegValue |= (((u32)ColorBankIndex) << (XOSD_GCABA_COL_SHIFT + GcIndex))
00924                         & XOSD_GCABA_COL_MASK;
00925         RegValue |= (((u32)TextBankIndex) << (XOSD_GCABA_TXT_SHIFT + GcIndex))
00926                         & XOSD_GCABA_TXT_MASK;
00927         RegValue |= (((u32)CharBankIndex) << (XOSD_GCABA_CHR_SHIFT + GcIndex))
00928                         & XOSD_GCABA_CHR_MASK;
00929         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCABA, RegValue);
00930 
00931         return;
00932 }
00933 
00934 /*****************************************************************************/
00935 /**
00936  * This function creates an instruction for an OSD.
00937  *
00938  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
00939  *         worked on.
00940  * @param  InstructionPtr is a pointer to the instruction buffer to be
00941  *         populated with the instruction to be created. The upper level
00942  *         application is responsible for allocating this instruction buffer.
00943  * @param  GcIndex indicates the Graphics Controller that will consume the
00944  *         instruction. Valid value range is from 0 to
00945  *         (The Number of Layers) - 1. The layer's type must
00946  *         be set to XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_GPU (defined in xosd_hw.h) for this
00947  *         function to work properly.
00948  * @param  ObjType indicates the type of object to draw. Use
00949  *         one of XOSD_INS_OPCODE_... constants defined in xosd_hw.h.
00950  * @param  ObjSize indicates line width of boxes and lines and the text scale
00951  *         factor for text boxes.
00952  * @param  XStart indicates the horizontal start pixel of the Object.
00953  * @param  YStart indicates the vertical start line of the Object.
00954  * @param  XEnd indicates the horizontal end pixel of the Object.
00955  * @param  YEnd indicates the vertical end line of the Object.
00956  * @param  TextIndex indicates the string index.
00957  * @param  ColorIndex indicates the color index.
00958  * @return NONE.
00959  *
00960  *****************************************************************************/
00961 void XOSD_CreateInstruction(XOSD *InstancePtr, u32 *InstructionPtr,
00962                                 u8 GcIndex, u16 ObjType, u8 ObjSize,
00963                                 u16 XStart, u16 YStart, u16 XEnd, u16 YEnd,
00964                                 u8 TextIndex, u8 ColorIndex)
00965 {
00966         u32 Value;
00967 
00968         /* Verify arguments */
00969         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
00970         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
00971         XASSERT_VOID(InstructionPtr != NULL);
00972         XASSERT_VOID(GcIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
00973         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].LayerType ==
00974                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_GPU);
00975         XASSERT_VOID((ObjType == XOSD_INS_OPCODE_END) ||
00976                  (ObjType == XOSD_INS_OPCODE_NOP) ||
00977                  (ObjType == XOSD_INS_OPCODE_BOX) ||
00978                  (ObjType == XOSD_INS_OPCODE_LINE) ||
00979                  (ObjType == XOSD_INS_OPCODE_TXT) ||
00980                  (ObjType == XOSD_INS_OPCODE_BOXTXT));
00981         XASSERT_VOID(XEnd < InstancePtr->ScreenWidth);
00982         XASSERT_VOID(YEnd < InstancePtr->ScreenHeight);
00983         XASSERT_VOID(TextIndex < InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].TextNumStrings);
00984         XASSERT_VOID(ColorIndex < InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].ColorLutSize);
00985 
00986         /* Clear the whole instruction first */
00987         memset((void *)InstructionPtr, 0, XOSD_INS_SIZE * sizeof(u32));
00988 
00989         /* Populate instruction word 0 fields */
00990         Value = ((u32)XStart) & XOSD_INS0_XSTART_MASK;
00991         Value |= (((u32)XEnd) << XOSD_INS0_XEND_SHIFT) &
00992                         XOSD_INS0_XEND_MASK;
00993         Value |= (((u32)GcIndex) << XOSD_INS0_GCNUM_SHIFT) &
00994                         XOSD_INS0_GCNUM_MASK;
00995         Value |= (((u32)ObjType) << XOSD_INS0_OPCODE_SHIFT)
00996                                 & XOSD_INS0_OPCODE_MASK;
00997         InstructionPtr[XOSD_INS0] = Value;
00998 
00999         /* Populate instruction word 1 fields */
01000         Value = ((u32)TextIndex) & XOSD_INS1_TXTINDEX_MASK;
01001         InstructionPtr[XOSD_INS1] = Value;
01002 
01003         /* Populate instruction word 2 fields */
01004         Value = ((u32)YStart) & XOSD_INS2_YSTART_MASK;
01005         Value |= (((u32)YEnd) << XOSD_INS2_YEND_SHIFT) & XOSD_INS2_YEND_MASK;
01006         Value |= (((u32)ObjSize) << XOSD_INS2_OBJSIZE_SHIFT)
01007                                 & XOSD_INS2_OBJSIZE_MASK;
01008         InstructionPtr[XOSD_INS2] = Value;
01009 
01010         /* Populate instruction word 3 fields */
01011         Value = ((u32)ColorIndex) & XOSD_INS3_COL_MASK;
01012         InstructionPtr[XOSD_INS3] = Value;
01013 
01014         return;
01015 }
01016 
01017 /*****************************************************************************/
01018 /**
01019  * This function load an instruction list to be used by an Graphic Controller
01020  * in an OSD device.
01021  *
01022  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
01023  *         worked on.
01024  * @param  GcIndex indicates which Graphics Controller to work on. Valid value
01025  *         range is from 0 to (The Number of Layers) - 1. The layer's type must
01026  *         be set to XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_GPU (defined in xosd_hw.h) for this
01027  *         function to work properly.
01028  * @param  BankIndex indicates which GC Bank to be worked on. Valid value range
01029  *         is from 0 to XOSD_GC_BANK_NUM.
01030  * @param  InstSetPtr is a pointer to the start of the instruction list to load
01031  *         into the OSD device. The last instruction in the list must has
01032  *         XOSD_INS_OPCODE_END type.
01033  * @param  InstNum indicates the number of the instructions in the list to
01034  *         load. Valid value range is from 1 to the half of the size of the
01035  *         instruction memory created for the Graphic Controller
01036  * @return NONE.
01037  *
01038  *****************************************************************************/
01039 void XOSD_LoadInstructionList(XOSD *InstancePtr, u8 GcIndex, u8 BankIndex,
01040                                 u32 *InstSetPtr, u32 InstNum)
01041 {
01042         u32 RegValue;
01043         u32 i;
01044 
01045         /* Verify arguments */
01046         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
01047         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->IsReady == XCOMPONENT_IS_READY);
01048         XASSERT_VOID(GcIndex < InstancePtr->Config.LayerNum);
01049         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].LayerType ==
01050                         XOSD_LAYER_TYPE_GPU);
01051         XASSERT_VOID(BankIndex < XOSD_GC_BANK_NUM);
01052         XASSERT_VOID(InstSetPtr != NULL);
01053         XASSERT_VOID(InstNum <= InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].InstructionNum);
01054 
01055         /* Choose which bank to be loaded */
01056         RegValue = (((u32)BankIndex) + XOSD_GCWBA_INS0) & XOSD_GCWBA_BANK_MASK;
01057         RegValue |= (((u32)GcIndex) << XOSD_GCWBA_GCNUM_SHIFT)
01058                         & XOSD_GCWBA_GCNUM_MASK;
01059         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCWBA, RegValue);
01060 
01061         for (i = 0; i < InstNum * XOSD_INS_SIZE; i++)
01062                 XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCD,
01063                                 InstSetPtr[i]);
01064 
01065         /*
01066          * Notify OSD this is the end of the instruction list by adding an END
01067          * instruction
01068          */
01069         if (InstNum < InstancePtr->Layers[GcIndex].InstructionNum)
01070                 for (i = 0; i < XOSD_INS_SIZE; i++)
01071                         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress,
01072                                         XOSD_GCD, 0);
01073 
01074 
01075         /* Set the active instruction bank */
01076         RegValue = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCABA);
01077         RegValue &= ~(1 << GcIndex);
01078         RegValue |= BankIndex << GcIndex;
01079         XOSD_WriteReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_GCABA, RegValue);
01080 
01081         return;
01082 }
01083 
01084 /*****************************************************************************/
01085 /*
01086  * This function populates the Layer array in the OSD driver instance with
01087  * the properties of all layers. This is to help fetch the info faster later.
01088  *
01089  * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be worked on.
01090  * @param  CfgPtr points to the configuration structure associated with the
01091  *         OSD device.
01092  * @return None
01093  *
01094  *****************************************************************************/
01095 static void PopulateLayerProperty(XOSD *InstancePtr, XOSD_Config *CfgPtr)
01096 {
01097         XOSD *IP;
01098         XOSD_Config *Cfg;
01099 
01100         /* Verify arguments */
01101         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
01102         XASSERT_VOID(CfgPtr != NULL);
01103 
01104         /* Use short variable names to keep the lines in this function
01105          * shorter
01106          */
01107         IP = InstancePtr;
01108         Cfg = CfgPtr;
01109 
01110         /* Layer #0 */
01111         IP->Layers[0].LayerType             = Cfg->Layer0Type;
01112         IP->Layers[0].InstructionNum        = Cfg->Layer0InstructionMemSize;
01113         IP->Layers[0].InstructionBoxEnable  = Cfg->Layer0InstructionBoxEnable;
01114         IP->Layers[0].InstructionLineEnable = Cfg->Layer0InstructionLineEnable;
01115         IP->Layers[0].InstructionTextEnable = Cfg->Layer0InstructionTextEnable;
01116         IP->Layers[0].ColorLutSize          = Cfg->Layer0ColorLutSize;
01117         IP->Layers[0].ColorLutMemoryType    = Cfg->Layer0ColorLutMemoryType;
01118         IP->Layers[0].FontNumChars          = Cfg->Layer0FontNumChars;
01119         IP->Layers[0].FontWidth             = Cfg->Layer0FontWidth;
01120         IP->Layers[0].FontHeight            = Cfg->Layer0FontHeight;
01121         IP->Layers[0].FontBitsPerPixel      = Cfg->Layer0FontBitsPerPixel;
01122         IP->Layers[0].FontAsciiOffset       = Cfg->Layer0FontAsciiOffset;
01123         IP->Layers[0].TextNumStrings        = Cfg->Layer0TextNumStrings;
01124         IP->Layers[0].TextMaxStringLength   = Cfg->Layer0TextMaxStringLength;
01125 
01126         /* Layer #1 */
01127         IP->Layers[1].LayerType             = Cfg->Layer1Type;
01128         IP->Layers[1].InstructionNum        = Cfg->Layer1InstructionMemSize;
01129         IP->Layers[1].InstructionBoxEnable  = Cfg->Layer1InstructionBoxEnable;
01130         IP->Layers[1].InstructionLineEnable = Cfg->Layer1InstructionLineEnable;
01131         IP->Layers[1].InstructionTextEnable = Cfg->Layer1InstructionTextEnable;
01132         IP->Layers[1].ColorLutSize          = Cfg->Layer1ColorLutSize;
01133         IP->Layers[1].ColorLutMemoryType    = Cfg->Layer1ColorLutMemoryType;
01134         IP->Layers[1].FontNumChars          = Cfg->Layer1FontNumChars;
01135         IP->Layers[1].FontWidth             = Cfg->Layer1FontWidth;
01136         IP->Layers[1].FontHeight            = Cfg->Layer1FontHeight;
01137         IP->Layers[1].FontBitsPerPixel      = Cfg->Layer1FontBitsPerPixel;
01138         IP->Layers[1].FontAsciiOffset       = Cfg->Layer1FontAsciiOffset;
01139         IP->Layers[1].TextNumStrings        = Cfg->Layer1TextNumStrings;
01140         IP->Layers[1].TextMaxStringLength   = Cfg->Layer1TextMaxStringLength;
01141 
01142         /* Layer #2 */
01143         IP->Layers[2].LayerType             = Cfg->Layer2Type;
01144         IP->Layers[2].InstructionNum        = Cfg->Layer2InstructionMemSize;
01145         IP->Layers[2].InstructionBoxEnable  = Cfg->Layer2InstructionBoxEnable;
01146         IP->Layers[2].InstructionLineEnable = Cfg->Layer2InstructionLineEnable;
01147         IP->Layers[2].InstructionTextEnable = Cfg->Layer2InstructionTextEnable;
01148         IP->Layers[2].ColorLutSize          = Cfg->Layer2ColorLutSize;
01149         IP->Layers[2].ColorLutMemoryType    = Cfg->Layer2ColorLutMemoryType;
01150         IP->Layers[2].FontNumChars          = Cfg->Layer2FontNumChars;
01151         IP->Layers[2].FontWidth             = Cfg->Layer2FontWidth;
01152         IP->Layers[2].FontHeight            = Cfg->Layer2FontHeight;
01153         IP->Layers[2].FontBitsPerPixel      = Cfg->Layer2FontBitsPerPixel;
01154         IP->Layers[2].FontAsciiOffset       = Cfg->Layer2FontAsciiOffset;
01155         IP->Layers[2].TextNumStrings        = Cfg->Layer2TextNumStrings;
01156         IP->Layers[2].TextMaxStringLength   = Cfg->Layer2TextMaxStringLength;
01157 
01158         /* Layer #3 */
01159         IP->Layers[3].LayerType             = Cfg->Layer3Type;
01160         IP->Layers[3].InstructionNum        = Cfg->Layer3InstructionMemSize;
01161         IP->Layers[3].InstructionBoxEnable  = Cfg->Layer3InstructionBoxEnable;
01162         IP->Layers[3].InstructionLineEnable = Cfg->Layer3InstructionLineEnable;
01163         IP->Layers[3].InstructionTextEnable = Cfg->Layer3InstructionTextEnable;
01164         IP->Layers[3].ColorLutSize          = Cfg->Layer3ColorLutSize;
01165         IP->Layers[3].ColorLutMemoryType    = Cfg->Layer3ColorLutMemoryType;
01166         IP->Layers[3].FontNumChars          = Cfg->Layer3FontNumChars;
01167         IP->Layers[3].FontWidth             = Cfg->Layer3FontWidth;
01168         IP->Layers[3].FontHeight            = Cfg->Layer3FontHeight;
01169         IP->Layers[3].FontBitsPerPixel      = Cfg->Layer3FontBitsPerPixel;
01170         IP->Layers[3].FontAsciiOffset       = Cfg->Layer3FontAsciiOffset;
01171         IP->Layers[3].TextNumStrings        = Cfg->Layer3TextNumStrings;
01172         IP->Layers[3].TextMaxStringLength   = Cfg->Layer3TextMaxStringLength;
01173 
01174         /* Layer #4 */
01175         IP->Layers[4].LayerType             = Cfg->Layer4Type;
01176         IP->Layers[4].InstructionNum        = Cfg->Layer4InstructionMemSize;
01177         IP->Layers[4].InstructionBoxEnable  = Cfg->Layer4InstructionBoxEnable;
01178         IP->Layers[4].InstructionLineEnable = Cfg->Layer4InstructionLineEnable;
01179         IP->Layers[4].InstructionTextEnable = Cfg->Layer4InstructionTextEnable;
01180         IP->Layers[4].ColorLutSize          = Cfg->Layer4ColorLutSize;
01181         IP->Layers[4].ColorLutMemoryType    = Cfg->Layer4ColorLutMemoryType;
01182         IP->Layers[4].FontNumChars          = Cfg->Layer4FontNumChars;
01183         IP->Layers[4].FontWidth             = Cfg->Layer4FontWidth;
01184         IP->Layers[4].FontHeight            = Cfg->Layer4FontHeight;
01185         IP->Layers[4].FontBitsPerPixel      = Cfg->Layer4FontBitsPerPixel;
01186         IP->Layers[4].FontAsciiOffset       = Cfg->Layer4FontAsciiOffset;
01187         IP->Layers[4].TextNumStrings        = Cfg->Layer4TextNumStrings;
01188         IP->Layers[4].TextMaxStringLength   = Cfg->Layer4TextMaxStringLength;
01189 
01190         /* Layer #5 */
01191         IP->Layers[5].LayerType             = Cfg->Layer5Type;
01192         IP->Layers[5].InstructionNum        = Cfg->Layer5InstructionMemSize;
01193         IP->Layers[5].InstructionBoxEnable  = Cfg->Layer5InstructionBoxEnable;
01194         IP->Layers[5].InstructionLineEnable = Cfg->Layer5InstructionLineEnable;
01195         IP->Layers[5].InstructionTextEnable = Cfg->Layer5InstructionTextEnable;
01196         IP->Layers[5].ColorLutSize          = Cfg->Layer5ColorLutSize;
01197         IP->Layers[5].ColorLutMemoryType    = Cfg->Layer5ColorLutMemoryType;
01198         IP->Layers[5].FontNumChars          = Cfg->Layer5FontNumChars;
01199         IP->Layers[5].FontWidth             = Cfg->Layer5FontWidth;
01200         IP->Layers[5].FontHeight            = Cfg->Layer5FontHeight;
01201         IP->Layers[5].FontBitsPerPixel      = Cfg->Layer5FontBitsPerPixel;
01202         IP->Layers[5].FontAsciiOffset       = Cfg->Layer5FontAsciiOffset;
01203         IP->Layers[5].TextNumStrings        = Cfg->Layer5TextNumStrings;
01204         IP->Layers[5].TextMaxStringLength   = Cfg->Layer5TextMaxStringLength;
01205 
01206         /* Layer #6 */
01207         IP->Layers[6].LayerType             = Cfg->Layer6Type;
01208         IP->Layers[6].InstructionNum        = Cfg->Layer6InstructionMemSize;
01209         IP->Layers[6].InstructionBoxEnable  = Cfg->Layer6InstructionBoxEnable;
01210         IP->Layers[6].InstructionLineEnable = Cfg->Layer6InstructionLineEnable;
01211         IP->Layers[6].InstructionTextEnable = Cfg->Layer6InstructionTextEnable;
01212         IP->Layers[6].ColorLutSize          = Cfg->Layer6ColorLutSize;
01213         IP->Layers[6].ColorLutMemoryType    = Cfg->Layer6ColorLutMemoryType;
01214         IP->Layers[6].FontNumChars          = Cfg->Layer6FontNumChars;
01215         IP->Layers[6].FontWidth             = Cfg->Layer6FontWidth;
01216         IP->Layers[6].FontHeight            = Cfg->Layer6FontHeight;
01217         IP->Layers[6].FontBitsPerPixel      = Cfg->Layer6FontBitsPerPixel;
01218         IP->Layers[6].FontAsciiOffset       = Cfg->Layer6FontAsciiOffset;
01219         IP->Layers[6].TextNumStrings        = Cfg->Layer6TextNumStrings;
01220         IP->Layers[6].TextMaxStringLength   = Cfg->Layer6TextMaxStringLength;
01221 
01222         /* Layer #7 */
01223         IP->Layers[7].LayerType             = Cfg->Layer7Type;
01224         IP->Layers[7].InstructionNum        = Cfg->Layer7InstructionMemSize;
01225         IP->Layers[7].InstructionBoxEnable  = Cfg->Layer7InstructionBoxEnable;
01226         IP->Layers[7].InstructionLineEnable = Cfg->Layer7InstructionLineEnable;
01227         IP->Layers[7].InstructionTextEnable = Cfg->Layer7InstructionTextEnable;
01228         IP->Layers[7].ColorLutSize          = Cfg->Layer7ColorLutSize;
01229         IP->Layers[7].ColorLutMemoryType    = Cfg->Layer7ColorLutMemoryType;
01230         IP->Layers[7].FontNumChars          = Cfg->Layer7FontNumChars;
01231         IP->Layers[7].FontWidth             = Cfg->Layer7FontWidth;
01232         IP->Layers[7].FontHeight            = Cfg->Layer7FontHeight;
01233         IP->Layers[7].FontBitsPerPixel      = Cfg->Layer7FontBitsPerPixel;
01234         IP->Layers[7].FontAsciiOffset       = Cfg->Layer7FontAsciiOffset;
01235         IP->Layers[7].TextNumStrings        = Cfg->Layer7TextNumStrings;
01236         IP->Layers[7].TextMaxStringLength   = Cfg->Layer7TextMaxStringLength;
01237 
01238         /* Convert instruction memory sizes into the maximum numbers of
01239          * instructions supported
01240          */
01241         IP->Layers[0].InstructionNum       /= XOSD_INS_MEM_SIZE_TO_NUM;
01242         IP->Layers[1].InstructionNum       /= XOSD_INS_MEM_SIZE_TO_NUM;
01243         IP->Layers[2].InstructionNum       /= XOSD_INS_MEM_SIZE_TO_NUM;
01244         IP->Layers[3].InstructionNum       /= XOSD_INS_MEM_SIZE_TO_NUM;
01245         IP->Layers[4].InstructionNum       /= XOSD_INS_MEM_SIZE_TO_NUM;
01246         IP->Layers[5].InstructionNum       /= XOSD_INS_MEM_SIZE_TO_NUM;
01247         IP->Layers[6].InstructionNum       /= XOSD_INS_MEM_SIZE_TO_NUM;
01248         IP->Layers[7].InstructionNum       /= XOSD_INS_MEM_SIZE_TO_NUM;
01249         return;
01250 }
01251 
01252 /*****************************************************************************/
01253 /**
01254 *
01255 * This function returns the version of an OSD device.
01256 *
01257 * @param  InstancePtr is a pointer to the OSD device instance to be
01258 *         worked on.
01259 * @param  Major points to an unsigned 16-bit variable that will be assigned
01260 *         with the major version number after this function returns. Value
01261 *         range is from 0x0 to 0xF.
01262 * @param  Minor points to an unsigned 16-bit variable that will be assigned
01263 *         with the minor version number after this function returns. Value
01264 *         range is from 0x00 to 0xFF.
01265 * @param  Revision points to an unsigned 16-bit variable that will be assigned
01266 *         with the revision version number after this function returns. Value
01267 *         range is from 0xA to 0xF.
01268 * @return None.
01269 * @note   Example: Device version should read v2.01.c if major version number
01270 *         is 0x2, minor version number is 0x1, and revision version number is
01271 *         0xC.
01272 *
01273 ******************************************************************************/
01274 void XOSD_GetVersion(XOSD *InstancePtr, u16 *Major, u16 *Minor, u16 *Revision)
01275 {
01276         u32 Version;
01277 
01278         /* Verify arguments */
01279         XASSERT_VOID(InstancePtr != NULL);
01280         XASSERT_VOID(Major != NULL);
01281         XASSERT_VOID(Minor != NULL);
01282         XASSERT_VOID(Revision != NULL);
01283 
01284         /* Read device version */
01285         Version = XOSD_ReadReg(InstancePtr->Config.BaseAddress, XOSD_VER);
01286 
01287         /* Parse the version and pass the info to the caller via output
01288          * parameters
01289          */
01290         *Major = (u16)
01291                 ((Version & XOSD_VER_MAJOR_MASK) >> XOSD_VER_MAJOR_SHIFT);
01292 
01293         *Minor = (u16)
01294                 ((Version & XOSD_VER_MINOR_MASK) >> XOSD_VER_MINOR_SHIFT);
01295 
01296         *Revision = (u16)
01297                 ((Version & XOSD_VER_REV_MASK) >> XOSD_VER_REV_SHIFT);
01298 
01299         return;
01300 }
01301 
01302 /*****************************************************************************/
01303 /*
01304  * This routine is a stub for the asynchronous callbacks. The stub is here in
01305  * case the upper layer forgot to set the handlers. On initialization, All
01306  * handlers except error handler are set to this callback. It is considered an
01307  * error for this handler to be invoked.
01308  *
01309  *****************************************************************************/
01310 static void StubCallBack(void *CallBackRef)
01311 {
01312         XASSERT_VOID_ALWAYS();
01313 }
01314 
01315 /*****************************************************************************/
01316 /*
01317  * This routine is a stub for the asynchronous error interrupt callback. The
01318  * stub is here in case the upper layer forgot to set the handler. On
01319  * initialization, Error interrupt handler is set to this callback. It is
01320  * considered an error for this handler to be invoked.
01321  *
01322  *****************************************************************************/
01323 static void StubErrCallBack(void *CallBackRef, u32 ErrorMask)
01324 {
01325         XASSERT_VOID_ALWAYS();
01326 }
